Others: The match between Pakistan and England in the first T20I of their four-match series at Headingley Cricket Ground, Leeds, is likely to be called off due to rain.
The weather in Leeds is unfavorable for cricket, with rain since morning and heavy showers expected to continue from the match start time.
The match is crucial for both teams as it is the final outing before the T20 World Cup 2024.
Both teams are keen to avoid a rain-affected match as it is crucial to prepare their squads for the World Cup.
The Green Shirts drew the T20I series against New Zealand 2-2 at home, with one match called off due to rain.
Englandâ€™s last T20 series was against the West Indies in January, which they lost 3-2.
